revision_content.description: Learn how to measure, convert, and calculate quantities like length, area, volume, mass, and time using both standard and metric units.

subtopics.title: Units of Measurement
subtopics.definition: These are standardized quantities used to express physical properties like length, mass, volume, and time.

example.question: What is the SI unit of length?

subtopics.whyItMatters: Units help us communicate quantities clearly and consistently worldwide.
quickTips: Always include units in your final answer.
Stick to SI units unless told otherwise.

subtopics.title: Conversions Between Units
subtopics.definition: Changing from one unit to another, like cm to m or minutes to hours.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Conversions are needed in cooking, travel, sports, and science.
quickTips: To go from smaller to bigger, divide.
To go from bigger to smaller, multiply.

subtopics.title: Perimeter of 2D Shapes
subtopics.definition: The total distance around the boundary of a 2D shape.

example.question: Find the perimeter of a rectangle: length = 5cm, width = 3cm.

subtopics.whyItMatters: Used in fencing, construction, and layout planning.

subtopics.title: Area of 2D Shapes
subtopics.definition: Amount of surface a shape covers.

example.question: Area of a triangle with base 6 cm and height 4 cm?

subtopics.whyItMatters: Crucial in farming, tiling, land measuring, etc.
quickTips: Use different formulas for different shapes.

subtopics.title: Surface Area of 3D Shapes
subtopics.definition: The total area covering the outside of a 3D object.

example.question: Find the surface area of a cube with side 4 cm.

subtopics.whyItMatters: Used in painting, wrapping, and manufacturing.
quickTips: Visualize the 3D shape as flat nets.
Add up areas of all visible faces.

subtopics.title: Volume of Solids
subtopics.definition: The amount of space occupied by a 3D object.
subtopics.symbol: V = l × w × h (cuboid), V = πr²h (cylinder)
subtopics.whyItMatters: Used in storage, packaging, fuel tanks, etc.
quickTips: Always use same units before calculating.
Volume units are always cubic (e.g. cm³).

subtopics.title: Mass and Weight
subtopics.definition: Mass is the amount of matter in an object; weight is the force of gravity on that mass.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Essential in cooking, buying items, or packaging.

subtopics.title: Time and Timetables
subtopics.definition: Time is measured in hours, minutes, and seconds. Timetables help organize and plan events.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Time is essential in travel, school, work, and sports.
quickTips: AM is before noon, PM is after noon.
Learn to read and interpret timetables accurately.

subtopics.title: Speed, Distance and Time
subtopics.definition: Relationship between how far, how fast, and how long.

example.question: A car travels 120 km in 2 hours. Find the speed.

subtopics.whyItMatters: Key in transport, racing, delivery, and physics.
quickTips: Use the triangle method to remember: DST (Distance = Speed × Time)
